Sentencas: Perovskite electrodes have been considered as an alternative to Ni-YSZ cermet-based anodes as they afford better tolerance towards coking and impurities and due to redox stability can allow very high levels of fuel utilisation.
Titulo: Demonstration of high performance in a perovskite oxide supported solid oxide fuel cell based on La and Ca co-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: Unfortunately performance levels have rarely been sufficient, especially for a second generation anode supported concept.
Titulo: Demonstration of high performance in a perovskite oxide supported solid oxide fuel cell based on La and Ca co-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: A-site deficient lanthanum and calcium co-doped SrTiO3, La0.2Sr0.25Ca0.45TiO3 (LSCTA-) shows promising thermal, mechanical and electrical properties and has been investigated in this study as a potential anode support material for SOFCs.
Titulo: Demonstration of high performance in a perovskite oxide supported solid oxide fuel cell based on La and Ca co-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: Flat multilayer ceramics cells were fabricated by aqueous tape casting and co-sintering, comprising a 450 mu m thick porous LSCTA- scaffold support, a dense YSZ electrolyte and a thin layer of La0.8Sr0.2CoO3-delta (LSC)-La0.8Sr0.2FeO3-delta (LSF)-YSZ cathode.
Titulo: Demonstration of high performance in a perovskite oxide supported solid oxide fuel cell based on La and Ca co-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: Impregnation of a small content of Ni significantly enhanced fuel cell performance over naked LSCTA-.
Titulo: Demonstration of high performance in a perovskite oxide supported solid oxide fuel cell based on La and Ca co-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: Use of ceria as a co-catalyst was found to improve the microstructure and stability of impregnated Ni and this in combination with the catalytic enhancement from ceria significantly improved performance over Ni impregnation alone.
Titulo: Demonstration of high performance in a perovskite oxide supported solid oxide fuel cell based on La and Ca co-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: With addition of CeO2 and Ni to a titanate scaffold anode that had been pre-reduced at 1000 degrees C, a maximum powder density of 0.96 W cm(-2) can be achieved at 800 degrees C using humidified hydrogen as fuel.
Titulo: Demonstration of high performance in a perovskite oxide supported solid oxide fuel cell based on La and Ca co-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: The encouraging results show that an oxide anode material, LSCTA- can be used as anode support with YSZ electrolyte heralding a new option for SOFC development.
Titulo: Demonstration of high performance in a perovskite oxide supported solid oxide fuel cell based on La and Ca co-doped SrTiO3
